published_attributes.title: Table of Contents
published_attributes.serialized_body:
In this part you will:

  • Learn about the Xcode IDE
  • Create a project by yourself
  • Run the app from on the simulator
  • Get a grasp on Swift and it’s basics components
  • Learn how to create basic views (using IDE as well as “programmatically”)

blocks.text: Run the app from on the simulator
Get a grasp on Swift and it’s basics components
Learn how to create basic views (using IDE as well as “programmatically”)

published_attributes.title: Lecture 1
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Slides

  1. Xcode (p. 50) 
    1. Creating an Xcode Project for an App
    2. Navigation through Xcode
    3. Running Your App in the Simulator or on a Device / Debugging (p. 57)
  2. Swift
    1. Basic knowledge
    2. Creating properties
    3. Functions
    4. optionals
  3. Storyboards (p .79)
    1. Adding views / controls and connecting them to UIViewController
  4. UIViewController

Links that you may find useful:

Remove SceneDelegate

How to create a new Xcode project without Storyboard

Debugging View Hierarchies

published_attributes.title: Lecture 5
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Slides

  1. Error handling
  2. Any
  3. Casting (p. 306)
  4. Views (p. 187)
    1. UIView 
    2. layers
    3. View Coordinate System
    4. bounds vs frame 
    5. UIBezierPath 
    6. Fonts

Links that you may find useful:

Managing Content in Your App's Windows

Displaying and Managing Views with a View Controller

Showing and Hiding View Controllers

Model-View-Controller (MVC) in iOS – A Modern Approach

Views Programmatically

🎉  You are ready for your first task but before that let’s see how iOS team is building UI programmatically
